results_summary: The study found that strict adherence to ALT and HBV DNA thresholds might miss opportunities in some patients, and HBsAg clearance is the best therapeutic endpoint but is difficult to achieve with current treatments. Combination therapy with interferon and nucleoside analogues showed promise for higher HBsAg seroconversion rates.
population_specificity: Patients with hepatitis B, particularly those with acquisition in early life.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effectiveness and safety of milk protein hydrolysates containing Methionine-Alanine-Proline (MPH2) on blood pressure reduction and to assess ACE inhibition as a potential mechanism.
results_summary: MPH2, which contains Methionine-Alanine-Proline, did not significantly change blood pressure compared to placebo in either stage 1 hypertensive or prehypertensive subjects. The study found no significant differences in plasma renin activity or angiotensin I and II levels between MPH2 and placebo.
population_specificity: 70 Caucasian subjects with prehypertension or stage 1 hypertension.
effective_dosage: 6.6 mg Methionine-Alanine-Proline per capsule, taken twice daily (total 13.2 mg/day).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the role of alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels in identifying suitable candidates for hepatitis B therapy and optimizing treatment efficacy.
results_summary: The study found that patients with chronic active hepatitis B, characterized by low HBV DNA replication (<10^9 copies/ml) and high ALT levels, respond well to therapy, while those in the immunotolerance phase or inactive carriers with normal ALT levels are poor responders. Monitoring HBV DNA and HBsAg levels during therapy helps tailor treatment strategies for better outcomes.
population_specificity: Treatment-naive patients with chronic hepatitis B.
study_duration: Therapy duration varied, with interferon therapy continuing until week 48 in some cases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of IGF-I administration on functional hepatic nitrogen clearance (FHNC) as controlled by an infusion of alanine in healthy volunteers and cirrhosis patients.
results_summary: IGF-I reduced FHNC by 30% in healthy subjects but had no effect in cirrhosis patients, suggesting IGF-I downregulates urea synthesis in normal subjects but patients were resistant to this effect.
population_specificity: Eight healthy volunteers and eight patients with alcoholic cirrhosis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate risk factors contributing to the development of liver cirrhosis in patients with autoimmune hepatitis (AIH), including the role of alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels.
results_summary: Higher ALT levels (441 ± 423 IU/ml) were associated with a greater risk of developing cirrhosis in AIH patients compared to those with lower ALT levels (158 ± 182 IU/ml). Older age (≥ 60 years) was an independent predictor for cirrhosis progression.
population_specificity: 174 patients with autoimmune hepatitis (AIH), including those with and without cirrhosis at baseline.
effective_dosage: Not specified for alanine; corticosteroid doses varied (13.9 ± 15.8 vs. 31.8 ± 85.5 mg/day).

study_goal: The study does not focus on Alanine but rather evaluates the efficacy and safety of tocilizumab for rheumatoid arthritis.
results_summary: The study does not report specific findings about Alanine; it mentions mild, reversible increases in alanine aminotransferase enzymes as an adverse reaction to tocilizumab.
population_specificity: Adult patients with moderately to severely active rheumatoid arthritis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of pentoxifylline (PTX) on liver regeneration, specifically focusing on its impact on alanine aminotransferase (AST) levels and liver volume regeneration in patients undergoing major liver resection.
results_summary: PTX improved liver regeneration in patients with small remnant livers (RLBW ratio ≤ 1.2%) and significantly reduced postoperative AST levels on day 2. However, it showed no benefit for larger remnant livers or overall complications and was associated with more adverse events.
population_specificity: Noncirrhotic patients undergoing major liver surgery with inflow occlusion.
effective_dosage: Intravenous PTX starting 12 hours before and ending 72 hours after surgery.
study_duration: 84 hours (from 12 hours pre-surgery to 72 hours post-surgery).

study_goal: The study does not focus on Alanine; it examines clofarabine in combination with etoposide and cyclophosphamide for refractory non-Hodgkin lymphoma.
results_summary: The study does not report findings related to Alanine.
population_specificity: Patients with refractory non-Hodgkin lymphoma (diffuse large B cell, follicular, or mantle cell lymphoma).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to describe the types of therapy used for chronic hepatitis B (CHB) in France and assess patient characteristics and treatment responses, including alanine aminotransferase normalization.
results_summary: The study found that 59% of patients achieved complete virological response, while 45% showed biochemical response. Resistance to lamivudine or adefovir was detected in 32.6% and 22.1% of treated patients, respectively.
population_specificity: 1730 patients with chronic hepatitis B across 54 centers in France.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess adherence to treatment guideline-recommended monitoring of chronic hepatitis B (CHB) patients, including alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels, and identify predictors of monitoring and subsequent antiviral therapy initiation.
results_summary: The study found that only 53.3% of CHB patients were monitored for ALT levels annually, with higher comorbidity scores and male gender being significant predictors of monitoring. HBV DNA monitoring and higher comorbidity scores were predictors of subsequent antiviral therapy initiation.
population_specificity: Adults aged 18-65 with chronic hepatitis B (CHB) in a US healthcare claims database.

study_goal: The study aimed to investigate the prevalence of HCV RNA positivity and identify risk factors, including injection drug use, in chronic renal disease patients on hemodialysis, with alanine aminotransferase (ALT) as one of the measured markers.
results_summary: The study found that patients with positive HCV RNA had significantly higher mean ALT values (39 vs. 26.5, p < 0.01), indicating liver involvement, but did not assess alanine's direct effects or efficacy.
population_specificity: Chronic renal disease patients on hemodialysis in Porto Alegre, Brazil.
study_duration: Data collected from August 1, 2005, to August 30, 2006 (cross-sectional study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the potential pathogenic mechanisms of idiopathic noncirrhotic portal hypertension (NCPH) in HIV-infected patients, including the role of protein C and S activity and soluble CD14 levels.
results_summary: The study found that HIV-infected patients with NCPH had slightly elevated alanine transaminase (ALT) levels, lower protein C and S activity (though within normal range), and no significant difference in soluble CD14 levels compared to controls. The clinical presentation included portal hypertension signs, but liver stiffness was inconsistent with significant fibrosis.
population_specificity: HIV-infected patients with idiopathic noncirrhotic portal hypertension (NCPH) and age- and gender-matched HIV-infected controls without liver disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the renal, metabolic, and hepatic tolerance of propylene glycol (PG) in (pre)term neonates following intravenous administration of PG-containing formulations.
results_summary: The study found that unintended PG administration (median 34 mg/kg/24 h) for up to 48 hours was tolerated in (pre)term neonates and did not affect short-term postnatal adaptations. Observations on renal and hepatic function were similar to a historical cohort exposed to mannitol-paracetamol.
population_specificity: (Pre)term neonates

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the long-term efficacy and safety of tenofovir disoproxil fumarate (TDF) monotherapy in patients with chronic hepatitis B, including its impact on alanine aminotransferase levels.
results_summary: TDF demonstrated high efficacy in reducing HBV DNA levels (<400 copies/mL in 87% of HBeAg(-) and 72% of HBeAg(+) patients) and maintaining normalized alanine aminotransferase levels (81% and 74%, respectively). No resistance mutations to TDF were detected, and safety remained favorable over 3 years.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic hepatitis B (HBeAg(+) or HBeAg(-)) who underwent liver biopsy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the epidemiological characteristics and risk factors for HBV infection in maintenance hemodialysis patients in China, including the role of alanine aminotransferase levels.
results_summary: The study found that HBsAg (+) patients had higher levels of alanine aminotransferase (p < 0.001), indicating a potential association between HBV infection and elevated alanine aminotransferase in hemodialysis patients.
population_specificity: Maintenance hemodialysis patients in China.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Rab GTPases (Rab4, Rab7, Rab11) bind to the AT₁R's carboxyl-terminal tail and how alanine scanning mutagenesis affects this binding.
results_summary: The study found that Rab4, Rab7, and Rab11 bind to the AT₁R's tail, with Rab11 binding more effectively than Rab5. Alanine scanning revealed that proline 354 and cysteine 355 contribute to Rab protein binding, without affecting G protein coupling. Rab4 overexpression facilitated AT₁R dephosphorylation and reduced desensitization.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro or cellular study, likely using recombinant proteins or cell lines).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate therapeutic options for chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection in children, including considerations for treatment timing, drug selection, and monitoring for resistance.
results_summary: The panel concluded that treatment is not beneficial for children in the immune tolerant or inactive carrier states, while liver histology and family history may guide treatment decisions for immune active or reactivation phases. Interferon is the preferred agent outside clinical trials, with nucleos(t)ide analogues requiring careful resistance monitoring.
population_specificity: Children with chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of prune consumption on liver function, specifically focusing on serum alanine transaminase levels.
results_summary: The study found a significant reduction in serum alanine transaminase and alkaline phosphatase with the lower prune dose, but no change in aspartate transaminase or bilirubin. Prunes may have clinical relevance in improving liver function in certain cases.
population_specificity: 166 healthy volunteers divided into three groups.
effective_dosage: 11.43g (3 prunes) or 23g (6 prunes) soaked in 250ml water overnight, consumed daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of clevudine (30 mg daily) versus lamivudine (100 mg daily) in suppressing HBV replication and normalizing serum alanine aminotransferase levels in treatment-naive chronic HBeAg-positive patients.
results_summary: Clevudine demonstrated superior viral suppression compared to lamivudine at 48 weeks, with 73% of clevudine-treated patients achieving HBV DNA levels below 300 copies/mL versus 40% in the lamivudine group. No viral resistance was observed in the clevudine group, while 24% of lamivudine-treated patients developed resistance mutations.
population_specificity: Treatment-naive chronic HBeAg-positive hepatitis B patients.
effective_dosage: Clevudine 30 mg daily; lamivudine 100 mg daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the initial value, rate of change, and interrelationship between serum APAP and aminotransferases (including alanine aminotransferase, ALT) in patients developing hepatotoxicity after acetaminophen overdose, proposing a new risk stratification parameter (APAP × AT product).
results_summary: The study found that serum ALT rose rapidly (doubling time 9.5 h) while APAP fell slowly (half-life 4.8 h), leading to an elevated APAP × AT product during early antidotal therapy, particularly in patients with earlier hepatotoxicity (ALT > 1,000 IU/L). The APAP × AT product showed promise as an early risk predictor for hepatotoxicity.
population_specificity: Patients hospitalized for acute acetaminophen poisoning who developed aminotransferase levels > 1,000 IU/L.
effective_dosage: Not specified (study focused on biomarker levels, not alanine supplementation).
study_duration: Not specified (retrospective analysis of biomarker trends post-overdose).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of alanine, as a sodium cotransporter in oral rehydration solutions (ORS), for improving the management of cholera diarrhoea.
results_summary: The abstract mentions that studies are still needed to evaluate the addition of amino acids like alanine to ORS, suggesting that its efficacy in cholera treatment remains under investigation. No specific results regarding alanine's effects are provided.
population_specificity: Patients with cholera diarrhoea (implied, not explicitly stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the safety and efficacy of full-dose versus dose-escalation nevirapine in fixed-dose combination minitablets for HIV-infected children, focusing on adverse events like elevated alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in nevirapine-related adverse events between full-dose and dose-escalation groups, with transient ALT/AST elevations resolving spontaneously. Rash was more frequent with full-dose nevirapine but manageable.
population_specificity: HIV-infected children (median age 5 years, CD4% 13%).
effective_dosage: Full-dose nevirapine (Triomune Baby/Junior twice daily) vs. dose-escalation (half-dose nevirapine for 14 days, then full-dose).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of Theramine (a medical food containing Alanine) in treating low back pain compared to naproxen alone or combined therapy.
results_summary: Theramine alone or combined with naproxen significantly improved back pain and functional outcomes compared to naproxen alone, with no significant adverse effects on liver function or inflammatory markers. Naproxen alone showed elevated CRP and liver enzymes, suggesting Theramine may mitigate these effects.
population_specificity: 129 patients with low back pain present for at least 6 weeks, not mild in severity.
effective_dosage: Not specified for Alanine/Theramine. Naproxen dosage was 250 mg/d.
interactions: Theramine appeared to mitigate adverse effects of naproxen on liver function and inflammation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of serum alanine aminotransferase (ALT) as a criterion for initiating antiviral therapy in patients with chronic hepatitis B virus infection.
results_summary: The study highlights that serum ALT elevation is a key factor in determining the need for antiviral therapy, alongside other markers like HBV DNA levels and histologic assessment. It also notes the importance of additional predictors such as basal core/core promoter mutations, serum albumin, and platelet count in assessing complications of chronic hepatitis B.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic hepatitis B virus infection.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether venesection combined with lifestyle counseling improves insulin resistance and liver enzyme normalization (including alanine aminotransferase, ALT) in NAFLD patients compared to counseling alone.
results_summary: Venesection significantly increased the likelihood of normalizing insulin resistance (HOMA) and ALT levels in NAFLD patients, even after adjusting for propensity scores and BMI changes. The effect was consistent across subgroups, including those with normal baseline ferritin levels.
population_specificity: 198 non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) patients from three Italian referral centers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the relationship between plasma alanine levels and metabolic syndrome (MetS) before and after lifestyle modification.
results_summary: The study found that alanine metabolism-related AA (Ala-mAA) levels were significantly higher in MetS patients compared to non-MetS individuals, and these levels normalized after lifestyle modification. Ala-mAA levels were positively correlated with MetS diagnostic items, suggesting a role in metabolic dysfunction.
population_specificity: Japanese subjects (54 with MetS, 35 without MetS)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to establish Alanine as a reliable dosimeter for Boron Neutron Capture Therapy (BNCT) and characterize its response in mixed neutron and gamma radiation fields.
results_summary: Alanine dosimetry, combined with Monte Carlo simulations, effectively measured absorbed dose in mixed radiation fields. The study confirmed the reliability of Alanine detectors for dose monitoring in BNCT applications.
population_specificity: In vitro experiments and non-resectable liver metastases (therapeutic context).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether peripheral blood levels of alanine could serve as a symptomatic or therapeutic marker in schizophrenia.
results_summary: The study suggests that peripheral blood levels of endogenous alanine could be a symptomatic marker in schizophrenia, while exogenous alanine in augmentation therapies might serve as a therapeutic marker.
population_specificity: Individuals with schizophrenia (specific demographics not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the association between insulin resistance (HOMA-IR) and virological response (RVR and SVR) in chronic hepatitis C patients, including the role of alanine aminotransferase (ALT) ratios.
results_summary: The study found that a lower aspartate aminotransferase:alanine aminotransferase (AST:ALT) ratio predicted rapid virological response (RVR) in genotype 1 patients, while baseline HOMA-IR ≤2 predicted RVR in genotype 3 patients. Alanine-related markers were indirectly linked to treatment outcomes but not directly assessed for efficacy.
population_specificity: 412 treatment-naïve Caucasian chronic hepatitis C patients (59% male, mean age 45 years) with genotypes 1-4.
effective_dosage: Not specified (study focused on pegylated interferon α plus ribavirin, not alanine dosage).
study_duration: Not specified (follow-up included week 4 and sustained virological response assessments).

study_goal: The researchers were investigating the safety and efficacy of tocilizumab, an anti-IL-6 receptor monoclonal antibody, in children with systemic juvenile idiopathic arthritis (JIA), not specifically Alanine.
results_summary: The study found that tocilizumab effectively reduced fever and normalized inflammatory markers in children with systemic JIA, with transient increases in alanine aminotransferase noted as a common adverse event. Serious adverse events included anaphylactoid reaction and gastrointestinal hemorrhage.
population_specificity: Children with systemic juvenile idiopathic arthritis (JIA).
effective_dosage: 8 mg/kg at 2-week intervals (for tocilizumab, not Alanine).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the long-term durability of nevirapine, efavirenz, and lopinavir-based cART regimens, including their safety and efficacy profiles, but did not specifically focus on Alanine.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in adverse events related to Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels among the treatment groups, but did not specifically evaluate Alanine's effects.
population_specificity: HIV patients in routine clinical practice across Europe who started nevirapine, efavirenz, or lopinavir-based cART regimens after 1 January 2000.
study_duration: Follow-up started ≥ 3 months after treatment initiation if viral load was controlled.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of deferasirox, an iron chelator, in reducing iron burden in patients with hereditary hemochromatosis (HH), focusing on its impact on alanine aminotransferase levels and other safety parameters.
results_summary: Deferasirox effectively reduced serum ferritin levels by 63.5% to 74.8% across different dosages, with the most common adverse events being diarrhea, headache, and nausea. Higher doses (15 mg/kg/day) were associated with increased alanine aminotransferase and serum creatinine levels, indicating potential liver and kidney stress.
population_specificity: Patients with hereditary hemochromatosis (HH) who were homozygous for the Cys282Tyr mutation, had serum ferritin levels of 300-2000 ng/mL, transferrin saturation ≥ 45%, and no known history of cirrhosis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether isotretinoin treatment, which affects alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels, is related to insulin resistance in patients with acne vulgaris.
results_summary: The study found that ALT levels significantly increased after isotretinoin treatment, but there was no significant change in insulin resistance markers (HOMA-IR, fasting blood glucose, insulin, or C-peptide levels).
population_specificity: 48 patients with acne vulgaris attending a dermatology outpatient clinic.

study_goal: The study does not focus on Alanine; it examines the efficacy and safety of eltrombopag for chronic immune thrombocytopenia.
results_summary: The study does not report findings related to Alanine.
population_specificity: Adults with chronic immune thrombocytopenia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of alanine:glyoxylate aminotransferase deficiency in primary hyperoxaluria type 1 and the effectiveness of liver and kidney transplantation as management strategies.
results_summary: The study found that primary hyperoxaluria type 1 results from alanine:glyoxylate aminotransferase deficiency, leading to oxalate accumulation and renal damage. Liver transplantation, either sequential or simultaneous with kidney transplantation, significantly improved patient outcomes, quality of life, and growth.
population_specificity: Patients with primary hyperoxaluria type 1, an autosomal recessive disorder.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the safety of etravirine in HIV-1-infected patients co-infected with HBV and/or HCV over 96 weeks.
results_summary: The study found that etravirine had a similar safety profile to placebo in co-infected patients, with comparable incidences of adverse events and hepatic effects. Discontinuation due to hepatic adverse events was low and similar between treatment groups.
population_specificity: Treatment-experienced, HIV-1-infected patients co-infected with HBV and/or HCV, clinically stable with AST/ALT <5× upper limit of normal.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare fibrosis progression rates between HIV/HCV-coinfected patients and HCV-monoinfected patients, including the role of alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels in disease progression.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in fibrosis progression rates between HIV/HCV-coinfected and HCV-monoinfected patients. No clinical or laboratory parameters, including ALT levels, predicted disease progression.
population_specificity: Patients coinfected with HIV and HCV (n = 306) and HCV-monoinfected controls (n = 59).
study_duration: Median interval between liver biopsies was 4.7 years for HIV/HCV patients and 5.9 years for controls.

study_goal: To evaluate the efficacy and safety of telbivudine (LDT) in HBeAg-positive chronic hepatitis B patients with high baseline alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels.
results_summary: The study found that patients with high baseline ALT levels had significantly greater reductions in HBV DNA levels, higher rates of HBeAg negativity and seroconversion, and similar safety profiles compared to controls. The high baseline ALT group also showed a higher proportion of HBsAg negativity and seroconversion.
population_specificity: HBeAg-positive chronic hepatitis B patients with baseline ALT levels 10-20 times the upper limit of normal (high group) and 2-10 times (control group).

study_goal: The study does not focus on Alanine; it assesses ribavirin monotherapy for chronic HEV infection in kidney transplant patients.
results_summary: The study does not report findings specific to Alanine; it focuses on ribavirin's effects on HEV RNA levels and liver enzyme normalization.
population_specificity: Kidney transplant patients with chronic HEV infection.

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to determine the hemodynamic responses and clinical outcomes of patients with portopulmonary hypertension (POPH) treated with ambrisentan, not Alanine.
results_summary: The study found that ambrisentan monotherapy significantly improved pulmonary hemodynamic responses in patients with POPH without adverse effects on hepatic function. No results related to Alanine were reported.
population_specificity: Adult patients with portopulmonary hypertension (POPH)
study_duration: Median time on ambrisentan therapy was 390 days (IQR, 363-611)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify genetic variants associated with features of hepatic histology, including serum levels of alanine aminotransferase, in patients with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).
results_summary: The study found significant associations between specific SNPs and serum levels of alanine aminotransferase, including rs2499604 on chromosome 1, rs6487679 on chromosome 12, rs1421201 on chromosome 18, and rs2710833 on chromosome 4. No significant associations were observed for other features of NAFLD like steatosis or ballooning degeneration.
population_specificity: 236 non-Hispanic white women with NAFLD.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of mipomersen, an antisense oligonucleotide targeting apolipoprotein B-100, in reducing LDL cholesterol in patients with homozygous familial hypercholesterolemia (HoFH).
results_summary: Mipomersen significantly reduced LDL-C by 24.7% from baseline and lowered plasma lipoprotein (a). Common adverse effects included injection-site reactions and influenza-like symptoms, with some patients showing elevated ALT concentrations but no cases of steatohepatitis.
population_specificity: Patients with homozygous familial hypercholesterolemia (HoFH), a rare condition (∼1:1,000,000) with high cardiovascular risk.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of alanine aminotransferase levels in diagnosing biliary etiology in acute pancreatitis and discuss the pathogenesis of acute biliary pancreatitis.
results_summary: Elevated serum alanine aminotransferase (>1.0 microkat/l) was associated with a high probability (80-90% positive predictive value) of gallstone pancreatitis, supporting its diagnostic utility. The study also highlighted other contributing factors like anatomical variations and genetic predispositions in acute biliary pancreatitis.
population_specificity: Patients with suspected acute biliary pancreatitis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether perioperative oral nutrition with branched-chain amino acids (BCAA), including alanine, improves postoperative outcomes in patients undergoing hepatectomy, particularly in those with non-hepatitis livers.
results_summary: The study found that BCAA supplementation led to significantly higher serum erythropoietin (EPO) levels in non-hepatitis patients post-hepatectomy, suggesting potential benefits in liver cell protection and hemorrhage prevention. However, no significant differences were observed in postoperative complications or most biochemical markers between the BCAA and control groups.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing hepatectomy (20 with malignant liver tumors, 4 with benign liver tumors).
effective_dosage: BCAA supplement twice daily plus a usual diet.
study_duration: 14 days before operation and 7 days after operation.

study_goal: The researchers evaluated the safety, tolerability, and pharmacokinetics of higher doses of caspofungin, including its effects on alanine aminotransferase levels.
results_summary: Caspofungin was generally well tolerated, with only minor adverse effects such as infusion site reactions and one reversible elevation in alanine aminotransferase. Pharmacokinetic data showed dose proportionality and modest nonlinear accumulation, which was not clinically significant.
population_specificity: Healthy participants (16 for single-dose study, 20 for multiple-dose study).
effective_dosage: Single doses of 150 mg and 210 mg; multiple doses of 100 mg/day.
study_duration: Single-dose study (1 day); multiple-dose study (21 days).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if early on-treatment serum HBsAg levels could predict sustained response (SR) in HBeAg-negative chronic hepatitis B patients receiving peginterferon alfa-2a.
results_summary: The study found that combining declines in HBsAg and HBV DNA levels at week 12 provided the best prediction of SR, with a negative predictive value of 100% for patients showing no HBsAg decline and less than 2 log HBV DNA decline. However, HBsAg declines alone were of limited predictive value.
population_specificity: HBeAg-negative chronic hepatitis B patients (n=107) from an international multicenter trial.
effective_dosage: Not specified (peginterferon alfa-2a with or without ribavirin).
study_duration: 48 weeks of treatment, with follow-up until week 72.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether milk enriched with CLA isomers (including c-9, t-11 and t-10, c-12) affects blood lipid indices, liver function markers, and body composition in moderately overweight, borderline hyperlipidemic individuals.
results_summary: The study found no significant changes in plasma lipid levels, body weight, fat composition, or liver function markers (including alanine transaminase) after consumption of CLA-enriched milk compared to the control.
population_specificity: Moderately overweight, borderline hyperlipidemic individuals.
effective_dosage: 1.3 g/d of CLA (from enriched milk) vs. 0.2 g/d (control).
study_duration: 8 weeks per dietary phase, with 4-week washout periods.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of SNMC and SAM in improving liver function in pregnant women with chronic hepatitis B (CHB) without severe complications.
results_summary: SNMC and SAM significantly reduced ALT and AST levels, with SNMC showing higher normalization rates (64.3% vs. 21.4%). Adverse events included hypokalemia, hypernatremia, and hypertension, but no significant impact on fetal development was observed.
population_specificity: Pregnant women with chronic hepatitis B (CHB) without severe complications.
effective_dosage: Daily intravenous administration (specific dosage not mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to validate an updated definition of early allograft dysfunction (EAD) in liver transplantation, including criteria involving alanine aminotransferase levels, and assess its association with graft and patient outcomes.
results_summary: The study found that EAD, defined in part by elevated alanine aminotransferase levels (>2000 IU/L within the first 7 days), was associated with significantly higher rates of graft loss (26.1% vs. 3.5%) and patient mortality (18.8% vs. 1.8%) compared to recipients without EAD.
population_specificity: Deceased donor liver transplant recipients at three U.S. programs (n=300).
study_duration: Postoperative monitoring within the first 7 days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of propofol versus sevoflurane anesthesia on liver function tests, including alanine aminotransferase levels, after hepatectomy with inflow occlusion.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in peak alanine aminotransferase or aspartate aminotransferase levels between the sevoflurane and propofol groups, suggesting similar liver function test outcomes with both anesthetics. Other liver function markers and clinical parameters also showed no differences between the groups.
population_specificity: 100 patients undergoing elective liver resection with inflow occlusion.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (anesthetic dosing: propofol plasma target concentration 4-6 μg/mL initially, then 2-4 μg/mL; sevoflurane initially 8%, then 1.5%-2.5%).
study_duration: Duration of anesthesia during surgery (exact time not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether an intensive lifestyle intervention (ILI) could reduce hepatic steatosis and incident NAFLD in overweight or obese adults with type 2 diabetes, indirectly assessing the role of alanine aminotransferase (ALT) as a marker.
results_summary: The study found that ILI led to significant weight loss (-8.5%) and a greater decline in hepatic steatosis (-50.8%) compared to the control group. However, there were no significant changes in ALT or AST levels, suggesting these markers were not directly affected by the intervention.
population_specificity: Overweight or obese adults with type 2 diabetes (mean age 61, mean BMI 35 kg/m²).
effective_dosage: Not specified (intervention focused on lifestyle changes, not alanine supplementation).

study_goal: The study does not focus on Alanine; it evaluates the efficacy and tolerability of blonanserin compared to risperidone in treating schizophrenia.
results_summary: The study does not report findings specific to Alanine; it discusses adverse events related to alanine aminotransferase levels in the context of blonanserin and risperidone treatment.
population_specificity: Korean patients aged 18-65 with schizophrenia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify and characterize a genetic mutation (A485V) in the HCN4 gene involving alanine substitution and its association with familial sinus bradycardia.
results_summary: The study found that the A485V mutation in the HCN4 gene, which replaces alanine with valine, causes significant functional impairment of the ion channel, leading to symptomatic familial sinus bradycardia in affected individuals. The mutation was absent in controls, supporting its pathogenic role.
population_specificity: Three unrelated males of Moroccan Jewish descent and their first-degree relatives with familial sinus bradycardia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the association between NAFLD markers (including alanine aminotransferase, ALT) and cardiovascular disease risk.
results_summary: The study found weak associations between ALT and incident coronary heart disease, with potential U-shaped associations with total mortality. Evidence linking NAFLD to CVD risk was inconsistent due to confounding factors and limited data.
population_specificity: Individuals with NAFLD or elevated liver enzymes (GGT, ALT).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy of long-term ezetimibe (EZ) monotherapy in improving metabolic, biochemical, and histological abnormalities in patients with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).
results_summary: Ezetimibe therapy significantly improved NAFLD-related metabolic parameters, liver enzyme levels, and histological features such as steatosis grade, necroinflammatory grade, ballooning score, and NAFLD activity score (NAS), though fibrosis stage remained unchanged.
population_specificity: 45 patients with newly diagnosed, liver biopsy-proven NAFLD.

study_goal: To assess changes in serum alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels in nondrinkers receiving acetaminophen for 10 days.
results_summary: Acetaminophen at 4 g/day for 10 days caused statistically significant but asymptomatic ALT elevations in healthy nondrinkers, with no signs of liver injury. The clinical relevance of these elevations remains unclear.
population_specificity: 24 healthy volunteers with minimal alcohol consumption (<1 drink/day).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy, safety, and tolerability of nebicapone, a catechol-O-methyltransferase inhibitor, in treating motor fluctuations in Parkinson's disease patients.
results_summary: Nebicapone 150 mg significantly reduced daily "Off" time compared to placebo, with a mean decrease of 106 minutes. However, clinically relevant liver transaminase elevations were observed in some patients at this dose.
population_specificity: 252 Parkinson's disease patients with motor fluctuations, treated with levodopa/carbidopa or levodopa/benserazide.
effective_dosage: Nebicapone 50 mg, 100 mg, or 150 mg; entacapone 200 mg (active control).
interactions: Administered concomitantly with levodopa/carbidopa or levodopa/benserazide.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of prophylactic albumin (not alanine) for preventing ifosfamide-induced encephalopathy (IIE) and to identify risk factors for IIE.
results_summary: The study found that prophylactic albumin was ineffective in preventing IIE, with higher IIE occurrence in the albumin group (15.6%) compared to the no-albumin group (1.6%). Elevated alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels were associated with IIE, but the study did not focus on alanine supplementation.
population_specificity: Adults receiving ifosfamide-based chemotherapy for hematologic or solid tumor malignancies.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the sensitivity and specificity of different diagnostic assays for detecting anti-Chikungunya virus IgM, focusing on the impact of amino acid variants (including alanine at residue 226) in viral proteins.
results_summary: The study found that the amino acid substitution (E1-A226V) in CHIKV strains affected IgM detection efficacy, with MAC-ELISA using CHIKV-226V detecting IgM earlier in the second outbreak compared to CHIKV-A226. Specificity was high for commercial assays (100%) and slightly lower for in-house MAC-ELISAs (95.6%).
population_specificity: Sera from patients during two Chikungunya disease outbreaks in Singapore (2008).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of alanine aminotransferase normalization as an endpoint for determining treatment success in chronic hepatitis B.
results_summary: The study found that alanine aminotransferase normalization is a key endpoint for assessing treatment success in chronic hepatitis B, alongside viral suppression and other markers. The approved therapies, including interferons and nucleos(t)ide analogs, effectively suppress HBV replication and prevent disease progression.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic hepatitis B.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the associations of clinical and laboratory variables, including alanine aminotransferase levels, with the diagnosis and severity of nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) and nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).
results_summary: Higher levels of alanine aminotransferase were associated with definite NASH, but the study found that readily available clinical and laboratory variables were insufficient to reliably predict the presence and severity of NASH, though they performed better for predicting advanced fibrosis.
population_specificity: 1266 adults (median age 50 years, 82% white, 12% Hispanic) enrolled in NASH CRN studies, with 1101 having available liver histology.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and resistance of entecavir monotherapy, adefovir monotherapy, and adefovir add-on lamivudine therapy in lamivudine-resistant chronic hepatitis B patients.
results_summary: Adefovir add-on therapy showed superior HBV replication suppression compared to monotherapies, with higher HBV-DNA undetectability rates and no genotypic resistance. ETV monotherapy had higher viral breakthrough rates, while ADV add-on therapy demonstrated better HBeAg seroconversion rates.
population_specificity: Patients with lamivudine-resistant chronic hepatitis B (n=104).
effective_dosage: ETV 1.0 mg once daily; ADV 10 mg once daily; ADV 10 mg once daily added to LAM.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the durability of sustained virologic response (SVR) in hepatitis C virus (HCV) patients treated with peginterferon alfa-2a alone or in combination with ribavirin, including those with normal alanine aminotransferase levels.
results_summary: The study found that 99.1% of patients who achieved SVR maintained undetectable HCV RNA levels for nearly 4 years post-treatment, suggesting long-term efficacy. A small fraction (0.9%) showed detectable HCV RNA, possibly due to reinfection or relapse.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic hepatitis C infection, including those coinfected with HIV and HCV, and those with normal alanine aminotransferase levels.

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to determine the association between subject-rated fatigue and alanine aminotransferase levels in injection drug users with acute hepatitis C.
results_summary: The study found that subject-rated fatigue was associated with alanine aminotransferase levels at baseline, but no further effects of alanine were discussed.
population_specificity: Injection drug users with acute hepatitis C.
study_duration: Not applicable (observation period was 24 weeks, but no alanine intervention was administered).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of a fish oil-enriched parenteral nutrition regimen, including its effects on serum alanine aminotransferase levels, in patients undergoing major abdominal surgery.
results_summary: The study found that fish oil-enriched parenteral nutrition positively affected serum alanine aminotransferase levels on postoperative day 6, along with other clinical outcomes, without serious adverse events.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing major abdominal surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of alanine (via mutagenic replacement of Phe544) in the binding of benzopyran-based IRAP inhibitors and its impact on catalytic activity.
results_summary: Mutagenic replacement of Phe544 with alanine resulted in either complete loss of catalytic activity or altered hydrolysis velocity, demonstrating its key role in inhibitor binding and substrate positioning. The study revealed how alanine substitution disrupts interactions critical for IRAP function.
population_specificity: In vitro study using human IRAP and molecular models.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to establish a predictive algorithm for selecting optimal candidates for IFN-alpha treatment in HBeAg-positive hepatitis B patients, using baseline characteristics including alanine aminotransferase (ALT).
results_summary: The study identified ALT, HBV DNA level, AST, HBV genotype, fibrosis score, inflammation grade, age, and gender as significant baseline predictors for IFN-alpha therapy response. The predictive model achieved 86.4% accuracy for sustained combined response and 93.0% for partial/non-response in the training set.
population_specificity: HBeAg-positive hepatitis B virus patients (n=474) treated with IFN-alpha.
study_duration: Therapy duration varied; outcomes were assessed at 24 weeks post-treatment cessation.

study_goal: The researchers were not studying Alanine directly but mentioned it in the context of asymptomatic intermittent alanine aminotransferase elevation in individuals with haemophilia and hepatitis C.
results_summary: The abstract notes that asymptomatic intermittent alanine aminotransferase elevation is typical in individuals with haemophilia and hepatitis C, with biopsy evidence of advanced fibrosis in 25% of cases. No direct effects or outcomes related to Alanine supplementation were discussed.
population_specificity: Individuals with haemophilia and hepatitis C infection.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate factors associated with sustained virological response (SVR) to pegylated or standard interferon monotherapy in hemodialysis patients with chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection.
results_summary: The study found no significant association between SVR and factors like HCV genotype, alanine transaminase pattern, or liver fibrosis stage, except for younger age (<40 years), which was significantly associated with SVR. Pooled SVR rates for standard and pegylated IFN monotherapy were similar (39.1% and 39.3%, respectively).
population_specificity: Hemodialysis patients with chronic HCV infection.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic effects of grape seed extract compared to vitamin C on alanine aminotransferase levels and fatty liver changes in patients with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease.
results_summary: Grape seed extract significantly improved fatty liver grade and reduced alanine aminotransferase levels compared to vitamin C, regardless of initial steatosis severity. The benefits were observed over a three-month period.
population_specificity: Patients with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (mean age 43.2 ± 10.3 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the utility and shortcomings of alanine aminotransferase (ALT) testing and other biomarkers in predicting drug-induced liver injury (DILI), as well as explore genetic and clinical risk factors for DILI.
results_summary: The study highlights that ALT testing detects hepatic injury only after it occurs and is not a true predictor, while also reviewing other candidate biomarkers and genetic predispositions linked to DILI. It emphasizes the need for better predictive tools and prevention strategies.
population_specificity: Patients at risk of or experiencing drug-induced liver injury (DILI).

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to determine the effectiveness and safety of statins in children with familial hypercholesterolemia, not specifically Alanine.
results_summary: The study found that statins reduced low-density lipoprotein cholesterol levels in children with familial hypercholesterolemia, with no significant differences in serum alanine aminotransferase or other safety markers compared to placebo.
population_specificity: Children with familial hypercholesterolemia (aged 7 to 17 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the safety and efficacy of deferasirox (not Alanine) in reducing iron overload in beta-thalassemia patients post-bone marrow transplant.
results_summary: The study found no negative effects on AST, ALT, Hb, or donor chimerism, and serum ferritin levels significantly decreased. Serum creatinine increased but remained within normal limits.
population_specificity: Beta-thalassemia patients post-bone marrow transplant with poor compliance to phlebotomy and desferrioxamine.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the relative efficacies of various antiviral therapies, including their effects on alanine aminotransferase (ALT) normalization, in treatment-naive chronic hepatitis B (CHB) patients.
results_summary: Tenofovir was most effective in normalizing ALT levels (66% in HBeAg-positive, 73% in HBeAg-negative patients), while entecavir ranked second for ALT normalization (70% in HBeAg-positive patients).
population_specificity: Treatment-naive individuals with chronic hepatitis B (HBeAg-positive and HBeAg-negative).

study_goal: The study aimed to investigate the efficacy and safety of preoperative chemoradiotherapy with irinotecan and capecitabine in patients with locally advanced rectal cancer, not specifically focused on Alanine.
results_summary: The study reported a pathologic complete response rate of 25.0% and 5-year disease-free and overall survival rates of 75.0% and 93.6%, respectively, with mild toxicity profiles. Alanine aminotransferase elevation was noted as a Grade 3 toxicity in one patient (2.1%).
population_specificity: Patients with locally advanced, nonmetastatic, mid-to-lower rectal cancer (48 participants, median age 59 years).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study focused on chemoradiotherapy, not Alanine supplementation).
study_duration: Radiotherapy was delivered over 5 weeks, followed by surgery within 6 ± 2 weeks.
